Grid.Container.name: points
Grid.Container.description: In a point scale of 1...12, sets how the Grid.Container divides up the space available to the child items.

Grid.Container.name: alignment
Grid.Container.description: Adjusts where the child items will be placed within the Grid.Container along both axis.

Grid.Container.name: alignment_x
Grid.Container.description: Adjusts where the child items will be placed within the Grid.Container along the horizontal axis.

Grid.Container.name: alignment_y
Grid.Container.description: Adjusts where the child items will be placed within the Grid.Container along the vertical axis.

Grid.Container.name: spacing
Grid.Container.description: Adjusts the visual spacing between child items in the Grid.Container.

Grid.Container.name: spacing_x
Grid.Container.description: Adjusts the horizontal visual spacing between child items in the Grid.Container.

Grid.Container.name: spacing_y
Grid.Container.description: Adjusts the vertical visual spacing between child items in the Grid.Container.

Grid.Item.name: span
Grid.Item.description: In a point scale of 1...12, sets how many grid columns and rows the Grid.Item will span.

Grid.Item.name: span_x
Grid.Item.description: In a point scale of 1...12, sets how many grid columns the Grid.Item will span.

Grid.Item.name: span_y
Grid.Item.description: In a point scale of 1...12, sets how many grid rows the Grid.Item will span.

data.render:
Grid

Grid is a multi-part layout pattern for setting up a grid of items organized to a 12-point system.

NOTE: The REPL currently does not support viewport values. Resize your Browser instead.

Imports

<script>
    import {Grid} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const {Container, Item} = Grid;
</script>

Points

NOTE: By passing an array, you can set responsive values. e.g. points={["7", "tablet:6", "mobile:5"]}

You can adjust how many points the Grid.Container items are divided by via the points property.

Spacing

NOTE: By passing an array, you can set responsive values. e.g. spacing={["medium", "tablet:small", "mobile:tiny"]}

You can adjust the spacing between items via the spacing, spacing_x, and spacing_y properties.

Item Span

NOTE: By passing an array, you can set responsive values. e.g. span={["3", "tablet:2", "mobile:1"]}

You can adjust grid span of individual items via the span, span_x, span_y properties, by wrapping the items in Grid.Item.
